info.title: Prisoner Search
info.description:
Overview

This service provides a number of endpoints for searching and reading prisoners that have been registered with the HMPPS prison service. This may be current or previous prisoners or other people that might be in secure hospitals.

Data provided

The vast majority of the data is sourced from the NOMIS system though in the future this is likely to change as more HMPPS prison data is held outside NOMIS.

The data for a person is stored in Elastic Search and is updated after a record in NOMIS is changed. This is typically about a minute after the data is changed in NOMIS. In the unlikely circumstance that your service needs data that is 100% up to date with NOMIS then the prison-api might be a better service to use. One use case this might be appropriate for is if you need up-to-date data at the point a NOMIS prisoner event is received; this service also updates its records as a result of NOMIS prisoner events, so you might encounter a race condition if your read is triggered from the same event.

The data returned for each prisoner record is essentially a snapshot of key prisoner data. This includes the following:
  • Identifiers from both NOMIS and those held in other systems
  • Personal details such as name and date of birth (including aliases)
  • Current prison status such as the current location (including cell)
  • Latest sentence details
  • Alerts
See the schema definition for the API for full details.

Filtering response data

The Prisoner object returned from most endpoints has grown very large over time. This has become problematic for a few reasons:
  • Calls with a large number of results can have exceedingly large payloads returned, sometimes breaking response size limits
  • Some data points aren't suitable for all clients, in particular 3rd parties should not receive data they don't explicitly need
  • Most teams are only interested in a small portion of the response object; the rest is superfluous, noisy and a waste of resource

To address these issues, endpoints that return the Prisoner object now support filtering of response data via the responseFields query parameter.

For example, to only return the prisoner's name and date of birth, you would use query: /prisoner/A1234BC?responseFields=firstName,lastName,dateOfBirth

Note that it is also possible to specify nested objects or fields from lists of objects, for example: /prisoner/A1234BC?responseFields=aliases.lastName,currentIncentive.level

To find which fields can be included as responseFields call the endpoint GET /response-fields.

Role restrictions

Role restrictions in this service are applied by a `@PreAuthorize` annotation at either resource or service level. Furthermore the annotation can be applied at individual method level or class level.

Each endpoint in this API documentation should normally include what restrictions are applied. If there is any doubt then it is worth looking at the github repository at https://github.com/ministryofjustice/hmpps-prisoner-search/ and looking at the endpoint in question.

The following roles are currently in use in this service:
  • ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH. This role grants access to all of the search endpoints.
  • ROLE_PRISONER_IN_PRISON_SEARCH. This role is limited to protect the "/prison/{prisonId}/prisoners" endpoint for clients that only need access to this endpoint in prisoner offender search. For more general access the ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH would be more suitable.
  • ROLE_VIEW_PRISONER_DATA. This role is only needed at present for the "/prisoner/{id}" endpoint to retrieve detailed information about a particular prisoner, as opposed to the rest of the search endpoints in this service that can return multiple matches.
  • ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH. This role is deprecated and replaced by the ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH. All of the endpoints in this service that accept this role also accept ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH so the latter should be used in preference. It was originally created for Prison API and is still in use there.
  • ROLE_EVENTS_ADMIN. This role is only needed for the "/events/prisoner/received/{prisonerNumber}" endpoint and is only required in the event that a prisoner event wasn't raised by the service when their data in the service had changed.

Types of endpoints

Searching for a specific prisoner based on criteria

These are endpoints that use the core Elastic Search features to locate a prisoner record based on a set of criteria; for instance name, date of birth or unique identifier (such as the Police National Computer PNC number). Typically, they return many results and a summary of those results would be presented to an end user.

Matching records

Similar to searching but typically using a criteria from a different system; for instance, key data from a probation record or court record. These will use an algorithm that matches based on data that is likely to be most reliable for matching; for instance, PNC number or name with date of birth.

Retrieving a specific record

Retrieving a specific record typically by a unique identifier; for instance, prisoner number (aka NOMS number). This is a convenient way of viewing a summary of a prisoner record and is typically quicker than using the equivalent API in prison-api.

Retrieving batches of records

Retrieving a batch of records either by supplying a list of identifiers or a criteria that will a match many records; for instance, all people in a prison wing or people to be released on a specific date.

tags.name: Popular
tags.description: The most popular endpoints. Look here first when deciding which endpoint to use.

tags.name: Establishment search
tags.description: Endpoints for searching for a prisoner within a prison

tags.name: Global search
tags.description: Endpoints for searching for a prisoner across the entire prison estate, including people that have previously been released

tags.name: Batch
tags.description: Endpoints designed to find a large number of prisoners with a single call

tags.name: Matching
tags.description: Endpoints designed for matching a prisoner with data from other sources

tags.name: Deprecated
tags.description: Endpoints that should no longer be used and will be removed in a future release

tags.name: Specific use case
tags.description: Endpoints that were designed for a specific use case and are unlikely to fit for general use

tags.name: Experimental
tags.description: Endpoints that have not been tried and tested in a production environment

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

post.summary: Match prisoners who have a release date within a range, and optionally by prison

post.summary: Match prisoners by a list of prisoner numbers
post.description: Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role or PRISONER_SEARCH__PRISONER__RO

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

post.summary: Search for possible matches by criteria
post.description:
Search by prison number, PNC number, and/or name and date of birth, returning collated results by order of search.
       This will also search aliases for possible matches. 
       Use when there is manual input, e.g. a user can select the correct match from search results.
       Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

post.summary: Match prisoners by criteria, to search across a list of specific prisons use /match-prisoners

post.description:
Search by prisoner identifier or name and returning results for the criteria matched first.
        Typically used when the matching data is of high quality where the first match is expected to be a near perfect match.
        Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

post.summary: Match prisoners by a list of booking ids

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

post.summary: Find prisoners by exact or wildcard terms for specified fields and return a paginated result set
post.description:
Search terms and identifiers can be provided in either or mixed case and are converted to the appropriate case.
      This endpoint will find both exact values (full term matched) or wildcards supporting the '*' and '?' symbols.
      The '*' symbol will match any number of characters e.g. firstName='J*' will match 'John', 'Jane', and 'James'.  
      The '?' symbol will match any letter substituted at that position. e.g. firstName='t?ny' will match 'Tony' and 'Tiny'
      Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

400.description: Incorrect information provided to perform prisoner match

403.description: Incorrect permissions to search for prisoner data

post.summary: *** BETA *** Physical details search for prisoners within a prison / group of prisons - returns a paginated result set
post.description:
BETA endpoint - subject to change. Search by physical details.
      If a cell location is provided then only one prison can be supplied, otherwise multiple prisons are allowed.
      If lenient is set to false (default) then all supplied physical details must match in order for results to be returned.
      If lenient is set to true then at least one physical detail must match.
      Searches will return results for partial string matches, so searching for an ethnicity of white will return all
      prisoners with ethnicity of White: Eng./Welsh/Scot./N.Irish/British, White: Irish etc.
      Results are ordered so that prisoners that match the most criteria are returned first, then secondary order is by
      prisoner number.
      Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

post.summary: Match for an prisoner by criteria
post.description:
This is a more lenient version to other match endpoints that includes alias and fuzzy date of birth matching.
       It will return the best group of matching prisoners based on the request
       Specify the request criteria to match against.
       Role required is ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH.

400.description: Incorrect information provided to perform prisoner match

403.description: Incorrect permissions to search for prisoner data

post.summary: Search for prisoners by keyword or identifiers within a list of prisons and return a paginated result set
post.description:
Words and identifiers can be provided in either or mixed case and will be matched against all indexed text and keyword fields.
      Identifiers within the [and, or, not, exact] terms are detected and converted to the appropriate case.
      Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

post.description: Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH role or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role or PRISONER_SEARCH__PRISONER__RO

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to create queries over all attributes from the Prisoner record. Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

The request contains a list of queries to search on one or more attributes using a list of matchers. For example attribute "lastName"" requires a StringMatcher so we can query on "lastName IS Smith". Other type matchers include IntMatcher, BooleanMatcher, DateMatcher and DateTimeMatcher.

Each query can also contain a list of sub-queries. Each sub-query can be considered as a separate query in brackets. Combining multiple sub-queries gives us the ability to create complex searches using any combination of a prisoner's attributes. For example we can model nested queries such as "lastName IS Smith AND (prisonId IS MDI OR (prisonId IS OUT AND lastPrisonId IS MDI))".

To find all attributes that can be searched for please refer to the Prisoner record or get them from endpoint GET /attribute-search/attributes. Attributes from lists can be searched for with dot notation, e.g. "attribute=aliases.firstName" or "attribute=tattoos.bodyPart". Attributes from complex objects can also be searched for with dot notation, e.g. "attribute=currentIncentive.level.code".

Note that when searching lists of complex objects (e.g. aliases, alerts, tattoos) if you want to search for multiple attributes within the same object then you need to include them in the same query. For example, to search for alias "John Smith" you should search for aliases.firstName IS "John" and aliases.lastName IS "Smith" using string matchers in the same query. If you search for them in different queries you will receive anyone with firstName John and also anyone with lastName Smith.

Many attributes contain reference data restricted to a fixed list of values. For example, attribute "inOutStatus" only contains values "IN", "OUT" and "TRN". To find which attributes use reference data and to fetch the possible attribute values see the endpoint GET /reference-data/{attribute}.

String attributes support advanced search techniques such as fuzzy search matching and wildcard search. All String searches are case-insensitive (except for IS with fuzzy matching which is not supported by OpenSearch).

  • IS and IS_NOT require an exact match (wildcards ? and * will not work). E.g. If religion is "Christian" then "religion IS Christian" will match but "religion IS Christ*" will not.
  • For IS and CONTAINS some attributes support fuzzy matching e.g. they allow spelling mistakes. Call endpoint GET /attribute-search/attributes to see which attributes support fuzzy matching. E.g. If firstName is "Jonathan" then "firstName IS Johnathon" or "firstName CONTAINS Johnathon" will match. Note that fuzzy matches for IS are case sensitive but for CONTAINS they are case insensitive.
  • CONTAINS without wildcards (? and *) for a non-fuzzy attribute looks for the exact search term anywhere in the attribute value. E.g. If religion is "Christian" then "religion CONTAINS ist" will match.
  • CONTAINS with wildcards ? (single character) and/or * (zero to many characters) perform a wildcard search which must match the entire attribute value. E.g. If firstName is "Jonathan" then "firstName CONTAINS Jon*" will match but "firstName CONTAINS nath*" will not.
  • STARTSWITH checks only the prefix of the attribute value and does not support fuzzy matching or wildcards. E.g.If firstName is "Jonathan" then "firstName STARTSWITH Jon" will match but "firstName STARTSWITH Jon*" will not.
  • IN checks that the attribute value is any of the list of Strings provided in the search term. The search term should be a comma separated list of Strings to search, E.g. "searchValue1,searchValue2,searchValue3". This only matches exactly - no fuzzy search, wildcards or case-insensitive search is supported by OpenSearch. E.g.If firstName is "Jonathan" then "firstName IN 'Jonathan,Bob,Chris'" will match but "firstName IN 'Adrian,Bob,Chris'" will not.

To assist with debugging queries we publish events in App Insights. To search in App Insights Log Analytics run query: 

        AppEvents
        | where Name == 'POSAttributeSearch'

Example Requests

Note that the default "joinType" is "AND" so it could be omitted from the examples below (but is included for clarity).

Search for all prisoners in Moorland with a height between 150 and 180cm


Query: "prisonId = "MDI" AND (heightCentimetres >= 150 AND heightCentimetres <= 180)"
JSON request: 
        {
          "joinType": "AND",
          "queries": [
            {
              "joinType": "AND",
              "matchers": [
                {
                  "type": "String",
                  "attribute": "prisonId",
                  "condition": "IS",
                  "searchTerm": "MDI"
                },
                {
                  "type": "Int",
                  "attribute": "heightCentimetres",
                  "minValue": 150,
                  "maxValue": 180
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }

Search for all prisoners in a list of cells in Moorland

Query: "prisonId = "MDI" AND cellLocation IN (1-2-001, 1-3-014, 3-1-020)
JSON request: 
        {
          "joinType": "AND",
          "queries": [
            {
              "joinType": "AND",
              "matchers": [
                {
                  "type": "String",
                  "attribute": "prisonId",
                  "condition": "IS",
                  "searchTerm": "MDI"
                },
                {
                  "type": "String",
                  "attribute": "cellLocation",
                  "condition": "IN",
                  "searchTerm": "1-2-001,1-3-014,3-1-020"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }

Search for all prisoners received since 1st Jan 2024 with a dragon tattoo on either their arm or shoulder


Query: "(receptionDate >= 2024-01-01) AND ((tattoos.bodyPart = "arm" AND tattoos.comment CONTAINS "dragon" ) OR (tattoos.bodyPart = "shoulder" AND tattoos.comment CONTAINS "dragon"))"
JSON request: 
        {
          "joinType": "AND",
          "queries": [
            {
              "matchers": [
                {
                  "type": "Date",
                  "attribute": "receptionDate",
                  "minValue": "2024-01-01"
                }
              ]
            },
            {
              "joinType": "OR",
              "subQueries": [
                {
                  "joinType": "AND",
                  "matchers": [
                    {
                      "type": "String",
                      "attribute": "tattoos.bodyPart",
                      "condition": "IS",
                      "searchTerm": "arm"
                    },
                    {
                      "type": "String",
                      "attribute": "tattoos.comment",
                      "condition": "CONTAINS",
                      "searchTerm": "dragon"
                    }
                  ]
                },
                {
                  "joinType": "AND",
                  "matchers": [
                    {
                      "type": "String",
                      "attribute": "tattoos.bodyPart",
                      "condition": "IS",
                      "searchTerm": "shoulder"
                    },
                    {
                      "type": "String",
                      "attribute": "tattoos.comment",
                      "condition": "CONTAINS",
                      "searchTerm": "dragon"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }

get.description: This exists for developers to find all available values for responseFields parameters. Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role

BETA endpoint - reference data returned reflects the data assigned to prisoners
      rather than all the possible values.  Only to be used for searching existing data purposes.
      This method will also cache all reference data results for an hour and any new data will only appear after an hour.
      Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

400.description: Reference data search for attribute that isn't mapped

403.description: Incorrect permissions to retrieve reference data

BETA endpoint - alerts reference data returned reflects the data assigned to prisoners
      rather than all the possible values.  Only to be used for searching existing data purposes.
      This method will also cache all reference data results for an hour and any new data will only appear after an hour.
      Requires ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.

403.description: Incorrect permissions to retrieve reference data

get.summary: Get prisoner by prisoner number (AKA NOMS number)
get.description: Requires  ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH or ROLE_VIEW_PRISONER_DATA role or PRISONER_SEARCH__PRISONER__RO

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

get.summary: Get all prisoners in a prison, including restricted patients supported by a POM

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

get.summary: Get the next page of prisoners.
get.description:
To be used in conjunction with /prisoner-location/all. Uses the scroll id to get the next page of
      prisoners.  Calls should be repeated until a
      `null` scroll id is then returned, indicating that no more data is available.  Each call will return the scroll id,
      which should be used for the next call, rather than re-using the original scroll id.
      Note that the OpenSearch scroll will expire after 5 minutes, so if no calls are made during that time then the
      scroll id will be invalid.
      Requires PRISONER_SEARCH__PRISONER_LOCATION__RO role.

get.summary: Get all prisoners.  This will return the first page of results and a scroll id to retrieve the next page
get.description:
To be used in conjunction with /prisoner-location/scroll/{scroll-id}.
      This endpoint will return the first page of results (10,000 per page) and also a scroll id.
      This scroll id can then be used to make subsequent calls to return the data.
      It is required that this call will then be followed by calls to the /scroll/{scroll-id} endpoint to retrieve all
      the rest of the data, since it opens an OpenSearch scroll that will be cleared when no more data is available.
      Requires PRISONER_SEARCH__PRISONER_LOCATION__RO role.

get.summary: Search for prisoners within a particular prison establishment
get.description:
This search is optimised for clients that have a simple search term typically containing the prisoner's name
      or prisoner number. The user typically is certain the prisoner is within the establishment and knows key information 
      about the prisoner.
      
      Requires ROLE_PRISONER_IN_PRISON_SEARCH or ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH role.
      
      Sort fields supported are: firstName, lastName, prisonerNumber, dateOfBirth, cellLocation e.g "sort=firstName,lastName,desc"
      
      Examples:
      
      "/prison/BXI/prisoners?term=John&sort=firstName,lastName,desc&page=2&size=20"
      This will return all people in HMP Brixton whose first or last names begins with JOHN. 
      Results will be ordered by firstName, lastName descending. 
      Page 3 will be returned with a maximum of 20 results per page.
      
      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?sort=cellLocation"
      This will return all people in HMP Wandsworth. 
      Results will be ordered by cell location ascending. 
      Page 1 will be returned with a maximum of 10 results per page.
      
      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?cellLocationPrefix=WWI-2&term=smith"
      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?cellLocationPrefix=2&term=smith"
      This will return all people in HMP Wandsworth block 2 whose name starts with SMITH. 

      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?cellLocationPrefix=2-A-3-001"
      This will return all people in HMP Wandsworth cell WWI-2-A-3-001 

      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?term=A1234KJ"
      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?term=A1234KJ bananas"
      This will return the single prisoner with prisoner number A1234KJ in HMP Wandsworth. 
      An empty page will be returned if not found.

      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?term=A J&fromDob=1956-01-01&toDob=2000-01-02"
      This will return all people in HMP Wandsworth. Born on or after 1956-01-01 and on or before 2000-01-02, 
      whose name begins with A J, e.g Alan Jones born on 1956-01-01. 

      "/prison/WWI/prisoners?alerts=TACT&alerts=PEEP"
      This will return all people in HMP Wandsworth. With the alerts TACT or PEEP.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The primary search term. Whe absent all prisoners will be returned at the prison

parameters.name: alerts
parameters.description: alert codes to filter by. Zero or more can be supplied. When multiple supplied the filter is effectively and OR

parameters.name: fromDob
parameters.description: Offenders with a DOB >= this date

parameters.name: toDob
parameters.description: Offenders with a DOB <= this date

parameters.name: cellLocationPrefix
parameters.description: Filter for the prisoners cell location. A block wing or cell can be specified. With prison id can be included or absent so HEI-3-1 and 3-1 are equivalent when the prison id is HEI

parameters.name: incentiveLevelCode
parameters.description: Filter for the prisoners on an incentive level.

parameters.name: responseFields
parameters.description: A list of fields to populate on the Prisoner record returned in the response. An empty list defaults to all fields.

parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

400.description: Incorrect information provided to perform prisoner match

403.description: Incorrect permissions to search for prisoner data

get.summary: Retrieve all attributes supported by the attribute search
get.description: Returns all attributes that can be passed into the attribute search including their type.

prisonerIdentifier.description: Prisoner identifier, one of prisoner number, book number, booking ID or PNC

supportingPrisonIds.description: List of supporting Prison Ids to restrict the search by. Unrestricted if not supplied or null

fullAddress.description: The full address on a single line.  No fixed address records will have the fullAddress set to 'No fixed address'. Will never be null.

startDate.description: The date the address became active according to NOMIS. Will never be null.

primaryAddress.description: Whether the address is currently marked as the primary address. Will never be null.

noFixedAddress.description: No fixed address. This address record is only ever returned if it is also the primary address, otherwise it is ignored. Will never be null.

phoneNumbers.description: Phone numbers linked to the address. Note the phone number contains only numbers, no whitespace. Therefore searching on 'addresses.phoneNumbers.number' should not pass any non-numeric characters.

bodyPart.description: Part of the body that has the mark. From REFERENCE_CODES table where DOMAIN = BODY_PART. Allowable values extracted 08/02/2023.

comment.description: Optional free text comment describing the mark

level.description: Incentive level. Will never be null.

dateTime.description: Date time of the incentive. Will never be null.

email.description: The email address. Will never be null.

type.description: The type of identifier. Will never be null.

value.description: The identifier value. Will never be null.

issuedDate.description: The date the identifier was issued according to NOMIS

issuedAuthorityText.description: Free text entered into NOMIS when the identifier was recorded.

createdDateTime.description: The date/time the identifier was created in the system. Will never be null.

code.description: The actual language code, from domain LANG

readSkill.description:
The level of reading skill, from domain LANG_SKILLS:
    |Y  Yes
    |A	Average
    |D	Dyslexia
    |G	Good
    |N	Nil
    |P	Poor
    |R	Refused

writeSkill.description: The level of writing skill, see description for readSkill

speakSkill.description: The level of writing skill, see description for readSkill

statuteCode.description: The statue code. Will never be null.

offenceCode.description: The offence code. Will never be null.

offenceDescription.description: The offence description. Will never be null.

latestBooking.description: Indicates this offence is for the latest NOMIS booking. Will never be null.

sentenceStartDate.description: Start date of sentence - null if there is no associated sentence

primarySentence.description: Primary sentence - true if it is not a consecutive sentence, false if it is a consecutive sentence, null if no sentence found for the charge.

problemType.description: Problem Type, from reference data with domain 'HEALTH'

problemCode.description: Problem Code, from reference data with domain 'HEALTH_PBLM'

problemStatus.description: Problem Status, from reference data with domain 'HEALTH_STS'

type.description: The type of the phone number. Will never be null.

number.description: The phone number. Numeric characters only (no whitespace). Will never be null.

currentFacialImageId.description: The prisoner's current facial image can be retrieved by plugging this id into the prison-api endpoint /app/images/{prisonerNumber}/data?imageId={imageId}

lastMovementTypeCode.description: Last Movement Type Code of prisoner

lastPrisonId.description: The last prison for the prisoner (which is the same as the prisonId if they are still inside prison)

complexityOfNeedLevel.description: Complexity of Need level if female

mostSeriousOffence.description: Most serious offence for this sentence

recall.description: Indicates that the prisoner has been recalled

indeterminateSentence.description: Indicates that the prisoner has an indeterminate sentence

releaseDate.description: Actual of most likely Release Date

additionalDaysAwarded.description: Days added to sentence term due to adjustments.

nonDtoReleaseDate.description: Release date for Non determinant sentence (if applicable). This will be based on one of ARD, CRD, NPD or PRRD.

nonDtoReleaseDateType.description: Indicates which type of non-DTO release date is the effective release date. One of 'ARD, 'CRD, NPD or 'PRRD.

receptionDate.description: Date prisoner was received into prison at the start of the term

lastAdmissionDate.description: Date prisoner was transferred into the current or latest prison

automaticReleaseDate.description: Automatic Release Date. If automaticReleaseOverrideDate is available then it will be set as automaticReleaseDate

postRecallReleaseDate.description: Post Recall Release Date. if postRecallReleaseOverrideDate is available then it will be set as postRecallReleaseDate

conditionalReleaseDate.description: Conditional Release Date. If conditionalReleaseOverrideDate is available then it will be set as conditionalReleaseDate

locationDescription.description: current prison or outside with last movement information.

restrictedPatient.description: Indicates a restricted patient. Will never be null.

dischargedHospitalId.description: Which hospital the prisoner has been discharged to

dischargedHospitalDescription.description: Hospital name to which the prisoner was discharged

dischargeDetails.example: Psychiatric Hospital Discharge to Hazelwood House

heightCentimetres.description: Height in centimetres of the prisoner

weightKilograms.description: Weight in kilograms of the prisoner

hairColour.description: Hair colour. From PROFILE_CODES table where PROFILE_TYPE = HAIR. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

rightEyeColour.description: Right eye colour. From PROFILE_CODES table where PROFILE_TYPE = R_EYE_C. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

leftEyeColour.description: Left eye colour. From PROFILE_CODES table where PROFILE_TYPE = L_EYE_C. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

facialHair.description: Facial hair. From PROFILE_CODES table where PROFILE_TYPE = FACIAL_HAIR. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

shapeOfFace.description: Shape of face. From PROFILE_CODES table where PROFILE_TYPE = FACE. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

build.description: Build. From PROFILE_CODES table where PROFILE_TYPE = BUILD. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

tattoos.description: List of parts of the body that have tattoos. This includes marks and other marks whose comment contains 'tattoo'. 'From REFERENCE_CODES table where DOMAIN = BODY_PART. Allowable values extracted 08/02/2023.

scars.description: List of parts of the body that have scars. This includes marks and other marks whose comment contains 'scar'. From REFERENCE_CODES table where DOMAIN = BODY_PART. Allowable values extracted 08/02/2023.

marks.description: List of parts of the body that have marks. This includes NOMIS physical details of type 'marks' and 'otherMarks'. If we find a comment with either 'tattoo' or 'scar' we also add to the list of tattoos or scars. From REFERENCE_CODES table where DOMAIN = BODY_PART. Allowable values extracted 08/02/2023.

addresses.description: Addresses. Note that no fixed addresses are only ever returned if they are also the primary address, otherwise they are filtered out.

phoneNumbers.description: Telephone numbers. Note that the number will contain only numeric characters [0-9] (including no break between area code and number). Therefore if searching on 'phoneNumbers.number' you should not pass any non-numeric characters.

identifiers.description: All identifiers for the prisoner including those recorded against aliases. Currently supports only PNC, CRO, NINO and DL.

alertType.description: Alert Type. Will never be null.

alertCode.description: Alert Code. Will never be null.

firstName.description: First Name. Will never be null.

middleNames.description: Middle names. Will never be null.

lastName.description: Last name. Will never be null.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth. Will never be null.

raceCode.description: Ethnicity code. Will never be null.

ReleaseDateSearch.description: Search Criteria for Release Date Search

earliestReleaseDate.description: The lower bound for the release date range of which to search - defaults to today if not provided

latestReleaseDate.description: The upper bound for the release date range of which to search. A required field.

prisonIds.description: List of Prison Ids (can include OUT and TRN) to restrict the search by. Unrestricted if not supplied or null

prisonerNumbers.description: List of prisoner numbers to search by

pncNumber.description: Police National Computer (PNC) number (This will match both long and short PNC formats)

nomsNumber.description: The Prisoner NOMIS Id (aka prison number/offender no in DPS)

prisonerIdentifier.description: Prisoner identifier, one of prisoner number, book number, booking ID or PNC

prisonId.description: Prison Id, Prison Id or OUT or TRN

prisonerIdentifier.description: Prisoner identifier, one of prisoner number, book number, booking ID or PNC

prisonIds.description: List of Prison Ids (can include OUT and TRN) to restrict the search by. Unrestricted if not supplied or null

bookingIds.description: List of bookingIds to search by

page.description: The page number required in the paginated response

size.description: The number of results to return for paginated response

fuzzyMatch.description: Fuzzy matching. Allow a one character difference in spelling in word lengths below five and two differences above.

prisonIds.description: List of prison codes to filter results by

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth to filter results by

pagination.description: Pagination options. Will default to the first page if omitted.

bodyPart.description: Body part that has the physical mark, searching on the description in the type BODY_PART in the REFERENCE_CODES table. Allowable values extracted 08/02/2023.

prisonIds.description: List of prison codes to filter results by

cellLocationPrefix.description: Filter for the prisoners cell location. A block wing or cell can be specified. With prison id can be included or absent so HEI-3-1 and 3-1 are equivalent when the prison id is HEI

gender.description: Gender, searching on the description in the domain SEX in the REFERENCE_CODES table.

ethnicity.description: Ethnicity, searching on the description in the domain ETHNICITY in the REFERENCE_CODES table.
enum: Needs to be confirmed following Merge

minHeight.description: Minimum height of the prisoner in centimetres

maxHeight.description: Maximum height of the prisoner in centimetres

minWeight.description: Minimum weight of the prisoner in kilograms

maxWeight.description: Maximum weight of the prisoner in kilograms

hairColour.description: Hair colour, searching on the description in the type HAIR in the PROFILE_CODES table. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

rightEyeColour.description: Right eye colour, searching on the description in the type R_EYE_C in the PROFILE_CODES table. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

leftEyeColour.description: Left eye colour, searching on the description in the type L_EYE_C in the PROFILE_CODES table. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

facialHair.description: Facial hair, searching on the description in the type FACIAL_HAIR in the PROFILE_CODES table. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

shapeOfFace.description: Shape of face, searching on the description in the type FACE in the PROFILE_CODES table. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

build.description: Physical build, searching on the description in the type BUILD in the PROFILE_CODES table. Allowable values extracted 07/02/2023.

minShoeSize.description: Minimum UK shoe size of the prisoner

maxShoeSize.description: Maximum UK shoe size of the prisoner

tattoos.description: List of body parts that have tattoos

marks.description: List of body parts that have marks

scars.description: List of body parts that have scars

lenient.description:
Whether all terms are required to match. If set to true then only matches on all fields will return a result.
        If set to false then matches will return a higher score than non matches, but all will be returned.
        Prison and cell location will always be required to match.

pagination.description: Pagination options. Will default to the first page if omitted.

nomsNumber.description: The Prisoner NOMIS Id (aka prison number/offender no in DPS)

matches.description: List of prisoners that share the same possibility of being the match

orWords.description: Match where any of the keywords are present in any text field

andWords.description: Match where all keywords are present in any text field

notWords.description: Filter results where any of these words are present in any text field

exactPhrase.description: Match only prisoners where the full phrase is present in any text field

fuzzyMatch.description: Fuzzy matching. Allow a one character difference in spelling in word lengths below five and two differences above.

prisonIds.description: List of prison codes to filter results

pagination.description: Pagination options. Will default to the first page if omitted.

type.description: The type of search. When set to DEFAULT (which is the default when not provided) search order is by calculated relevance (AKA score). An ESTABLISHMENT type will order results by name and is designed for using this API for a single quick search field for prisoners within a specific prison

GlobalSearchCriteria.description: Search Criteria for Global Prisoner Search

prisonerIdentifier.description: Prisoner identifier, one of prisoner number, book number, booking ID or PNC

gender.description: Gender, F - Female, M - Male, NK - Not Known / Not Recorded or NS - Not Specified (Indeterminate)

location.description: Location, All or Inside or Outside

AttributeSearchRequest.description: A request to search for prisoners by attributes

joinType.description: The type of join to use when combining the matchers and subQueries

queries.description: A list of queries of type Query that will be combined with the matchers in this query

condition.description: Whether the attribute must be true or false

BooleanMatcher.description: A matcher for a boolean attribute from the Prisoner record

minInclusive.description: Whether the minimum value is inclusive or exclusive

maxInclusive.description: Whether the maximum value is inclusive or exclusive

DateMatcher.description:
A matcher for a date attribute from the Prisoner record.
  
  For a between clause use both min value and max value. By default the range is inclusive, but can be adjusted with minInclusive and maxInclusive.
  
  For <= enter only a max value, and for < set max inclusive to false.
   
  For >= enter only a min value, and for > set min inclusive to false.
  
  For equals enter the same date in both the min value and max value and leave min/max inclusive as true.

DateTimeMatcher.description:
A matcher for a date time attribute from the Prisoner record.
  
  For a between clause use both the min and max values.
  
  For < enter only the max value.
  
  For > enter only the min value.

minValue.description: The minimum value to match on

minInclusive.description: Whether the minimum value is inclusive

maxValue.description: The maximum value to match on

maxInclusive.description: Whether the maximum value is inclusive

IntMatcher.description:
A matcher for an integer attribute from the Prisoner record.
  
  For a between clause use both min value and max value. By default the range is inclusive, but can be adjusted with minInclusive and maxInclusive.
  
  For <= enter only a max value, and for < set max inclusive to false.
   
  For >= enter only a min value, and for > set min inclusive to false.
  
  For equals enter the same integer in both the min value and max value and leave min/max inclusive as true.

PncMatcher.description:
A matcher for PNC numbers.
  
    This is required because PNC numbers come in various formats with 2/4 long years and with/without leading zeroes.
     
    This matcher will find the matching PNC regardless of which format is used.

Query.description: A query to search for prisoners by attributes

joinType.description: The type of join to use when combining the matchers and subQueries

matchers.description: Matchers that will be applied to this query

subQueries.description: A list of sub-queries of type Query that will be combined with the matchers in this query

items.description: A query to search for prisoners by attributes

condition.description: The condition to apply to the attribute

searchTerm.description: The search term to apply to the attribute. Search terms are not case-sensitive.

StringMatcher.description: A matcher for a string attribute from the prisoner record

prisonId.description: Prison id. Current prison or OUT if outside. Will not be returned if no bookings.

lastPrisonId.description: Last prison id. If prisonId is OUT then will contain last prison, otherwise will be the same as prisonId. Will not be returned if no bookings.

scrollId.description: Scroll id. To be kept and used in next request

Attribute.description: An attribute that can be searched for in a query

name.description: The name of the attribute to be used when searching

type.description: The type of the attribute (used to determine which matcher to use)

fuzzySearch.description: Whether the attribute search will be fuzzy. Generally applicable to String attributes containing free text such as names.

view-prisoner-data-role.description: A HMPPS Auth access token with the `ROLE_VIEW_PRISONER_DATA` role.
view-prisoner-data-role.name: Authorization

prisoner-search-role.description: A HMPPS Auth access token with the `ROLE_PRISONER_SEARCH` role.
prisoner-search-role.name: Authorization

global-search-role.description: A HMPPS Auth access token with the `ROLE_GLOBAL_SEARCH` role.
global-search-role.name: Authorization

prisoner-in-prison-search-role.description: A HMPPS Auth access token with the `ROLE_PRISONER_IN_PRISON_SEARCH` role.
prisoner-in-prison-search-role.name: Authorization

prisoner-search--prisoner--ro.description: A HMPPS Auth access token with the `PRISONER_SEARCH__PRISONER__RO` role.
prisoner-search--prisoner--ro.name: Authorization
